Subject: RE: wow
Body:
People down here are shocked!  One of the brokers we use was in the second tower when the first plane hit.  All he said was that something blew up and he was getting the (*!@##$ out of there.   Sounds like it was a good decision as he was in the stairwell on the 20th floor when the second plane hit his tower.  He got out alright but many of his co-workers are still missing.  Lots of people have friends and family that worked there so people are keeping pretty much to themselves.  As for me.........I'm wondering why I moved to this country!  Things here are ok but I question everyday whether or not I made the right decision.  Hopefully, some good things start happening to me.  So far I have lost money trading, live with two cats I can't stand, don't have a car to drive (or any of my personal belongings) and this country is on the verge of going to war.  I figure things can only get better!

I'm back in town from the 19th-23rd...(assuming I can fly back)...and hopefully we can hook-up then.  If you need some kitchen-ware (i.e.. utensils) let me know and I'm sure we can work out a deal (There is no room for my stuff in this apartment).

Hope you are doing well and say hi to everyone for me.

Jon

 -----Original Message-----
From: 	"Glen Miller/CanWest/Contr/IBM" <gmille@ca.ibm.com>@ENRON [mailto:IMCEANOTES-+22Glen+20Miller_CanWest_Contr_IBM+22+20+3Cgmille+40ca+2Eibm+2Ecom+3E+40ENRON@ENRON.com] 
Sent:	Tuesday, September 11, 2001 9:52 AM
To:	Mckay, Jonathan
Subject:	wow

Hey Jonny, what's up?  Jeez, just heard about the bombings, how is that
affecting you guys?  Let me know what's going on....

Scotty told me about your house being sold....that's great.  I think I'm
going over with him tonight to start clearing out some stuff...I'll grab
the plants and the light like we discussed....Scott may store the poker
table for me.  Let me know if there's anything else you need us to do...

Hope everything's okay down there...

--
EnronData.org (http://enrondata.org)
Reference Enron Datasets

Subject: RE: New info
Body:
Glen,

YOUR ALIVE..!!!!!!!!!!   Glad to see you are still around.   What's with the new job?  For me the new job is obvious.  We started playing a drinking game where every time the name Enron was mentioned you had to do a shot.  Minutes later I was fired for drunken insubordination.  Sometime in the next 3-4 weeks I'll start working for UBS Warburg (Union Bank of Switzerland).  I'm hoping working for a Swiss company may finally get me out of the middle of all the conflicts (Terrorism, Enron, Anthrax).  No one should want to harm the Canadian working for the Swiss company.

Actually, my division was sold to UBS so the transition should not be that hard.  Mostly the same people, but on a much smaller scale.  If I could make the same amount of money for UBS I did for Enron last year, I'd finally get the Bonus I've always been looking for.  Anyways,  I'll keep you posted.  My Email hasn't changed yet, but I'm sure it will.  If you need to get in contact with me try, Bjenkins2@houston.rr.com

How's the personal life going?  I hope all is well.

Jon

Subject: RE: Holidays
Body:
Hey Jeff,

How's it going.   Things down here are actually very slow.  They (upper Management) are still trying to figure out what to do.  In the mean time no one is trading.  I sit around most of the day and play games.  I keep waiting for some instruction about what to do next and nothing is being said.  The old hurry up and wait.   Beth's (my girlfriend) whole department got let go the other day.  She is still there until Christmas doing the clean-up but, come the new year she is going to have to try to find a new job.  Things down here could not have gone worse for her. I feel real bad, because in a way I had a part in her moving, but there is nothing I can do about it now.

Are you an unsecured Enron creditor, as they agreed to pay for your school and now won't be able too?  How are thing there?  Are you liking school?

I'm heading back to Calgary on the 21st, and I'll be up there until at least the 30th (maybe longer).  I'd love to grab a beer if you have time.  You can reach me at (403) 239-0299, or I'll be stopping in at the office.

Take care and I hope to see you in cow town.

Jon

 -----Original Message-----
From: 	"Jeffrey R. Pearson" <Jeffrey.R.Pearson@Dartmouth.EDU>@ENRON  
Sent:	Wednesday, December 12, 2001 4:37 PM
To:	Mckay, Jonathan
Subject:	Holidays

I hope that everything is going okay down there for you, I talked to Chris
last week and he said that everyone was kind of just sitting around waiting
to find out what is going to happen with the trading group.  What did they
do with your girlfriends department?  Is she still there?

Are you going to head home for Christmas?  If so, when?  I am heading home
next Friday, and will be around till after New Years.  We should all try and
plan some time to get together if you are going to be there.

If not, I hope that things go okay and you have a Merry Christmas.

--

Reference Enron Datasets

 -----Original Message-----
From: 	"Jeffrey R. Pearson" <Jeffrey.R.Pearson@Dartmouth.EDU>@ENRON [mailto:IMCEANOTES-+22Jeffrey+20R+2E+20Pearson+22+20+3CJeffrey+2ER+2EPearson+40Dartmouth+2EEDU+3E+40ENRON@ENRON.com]

Subject:	RE: Currency

I would love to do closer to 15000, but 10 will definately work.  I have
about 14000 in tuition bills due in several weeks, and need to definately
convert some money.  Why don't you choose a rate, and e-mail me the rate and
your address (work is probably best, although I don't believe I have any
cards here and will need the address again!).  I will rush you a check,
which you can cash and then rush me back a check.

I really appreciate your help, and will hopefully talk to you soon (we will
have to talk one of these afternoons, as I am generally around and have no
classes!).

Jon

Dan Diamond

Subject: FW: HSFA and AIMR membership
Body:
-----Original Message-----
From: 	"Anderson, Donna F" <Donna_Anderson@AIMFUNDS.COM>@ENRON  
Sent:	Friday, January 04, 2002 1:22 PM
To:	Mckay, Jonathan
Cc:	'Shannacfa@aol.com'
Subject:	HSFA and AIMR membership

Jonathan:

Thank you for your interest in becoming a member of the Houston Society of
Financial Analysts. The AIMR web site is your best resource for information
and forms regarding AIMR and HSFA membership.

The HSFA has two categories of membership: Regular and Affiliate. In short,
requirements for Regular membership are a college degree, the successful
completion of Level 1 and three years of acceptable professional work
experience. Requirements for Affiliate membership are a college degree and
one year of acceptable work experience. "Acceptable work experience" is
defined as a professional position in finance or accounting.

The HSFA holds weekly lunch meetings from September to May. The meetings are
at noon on Wednesdays at the Houston Club downtown, 811 Rusk. In addition,
there are usually three or four annual events in the evenings. After you
become a member, you will be alerted by mail and e-mail about every meeting
and event. For more HSFA information, check out
https://www.aimr.org/socservices/socpage.asp?society=HOUSTON .

To join the Houston Society, you also have to be a member of the national
AIMR organization. For AIMR membership, go to
https://www.aimr.org/memservices/join/apply.asp and fill out the Membership
Application Form.

The HSFA currently requires you to have three sponsors: your supervisor and
two HSFA members, one of whom must be outside your firm. (If your supervisor
is an HSFA member, then only two sponsors are required.) If you do not know
any HSFA members, there are people who have volunteered to serve as
sponsors. Attached is a list; just give one of them a call. The form that
your sponsors will need is attached. They may send them in directly to AIMR
or to you. At AIMR, your application package is bundled together and sent to
me for approval. I send it back to AIMR, and they will alert you of your
membership status (and invoice you for dues) by mail. The whole process can
take five weeks or more, because AIMR only processes applications once a
month.

Please call me if you have any more questions.

Donna F. Anderson, CFA
AIM Funds
713-214-1097

 <<sponsor.doc>>
 <<sponsor.pdf>>

 - sponsor.doc 
 - sponsor.pdf

Subject: FW: Something for the boys? - part 2
Body:
This is accurate....Please take notes if you have to.

XO Jon
 -----Original Message-----
From: 	Watt, Ryan  
Sent:	Tuesday, August 21, 2001 9:36 AM
To:	Mike Treytiak (E-mail); Jay Bowman (E-mail); Clark, Chad; Bruce, Chad; Gary Cooper (E-mail); Sam Pel (E-mail); Lambie, Chris; Mckay, Jonathan; Cowan, Mike; Torres, Carlos; Powley, Barry; Cam Sherman (E-mail); Ray Shiu (E-mail); Renneberg, Mark
Subject:	Something for the boys? - part 2


TO WOMEN EVERYWHERE FROM A MAN WHO'S HAD ENOUGH:


1.) Learn to work the toilet seat. If it's up, put it down. We need it up,
you need it down. You don't hear us bitching about you leaving it down.

2.) ALL men see in only 16 colours. Peach is a fruit, not a colour.

3.) If you won't dress like the Victoria's Secret girls, don't expect us to
act like soap opera guys.

4.) If you think you're fat, you probably are. Don't ask us. We refuse to
answer.

5.) Birthdays, Valentines, and Anniversaries are not quests to see if we
can find the perfect present yet again!

6.) If you ask a question you don't want an answer to, expect an answer you
don't want to hear.

7.) Sometimes, we're not thinking about you. Live with it. Don't ask us
what we're thinking about unless you are prepared to discuss such topics as
navel lint, or the shotgun formation.

8.) Sunday = Sports. It's like the full moon or the changing of the tides.
Let it be.

9.) Shopping is not a sport, and no, we're never going to think of it that
way.

10.) When we have to go somewhere, absolutely anything you wear is fine.

Really.

11.) You have enough clothes. You have too many shoes.

12.) Crying is blackmail.

13.) Ask for what you want. Let's be clear on this one: Subtle hints don't
work. Strong hints don't work. Really obvious hints don't work. Just say
it!

14.) No, we don't know what day it is. We never will. Mark Anniversaries on
the calendar.

15.) Peeing standing up is more difficult. We're bound to miss sometimes.

16.) Most guys own three pairs of shoes. What makes you think we'd be any
good at choosing which pair, out of thirty, would look good with your
dress?

17.) Yes, and No are perfectly acceptable answers to almost every question.

18.) Come to us with a problem only if you want help solving it. That's
what we do.

19.) Sympathy is what your girlfriends are for.

20.) A headache that lasts for 17 months is a problem. See a doctor.

21.) Foreign films are best left to foreigners. (Unless it's Bruce Lee or
some war flick where it doesn't really matter what they're saying anyway.

22.) Check your oil.

23.) It is neither in your best interest nor ours to take the quiz
together.

24.) No, it doesn't matter which quiz.

25.) Anything we said 6 months ago is inadmissible in an argument. All
comments become null and void after 7 days.

26.) If something we said can be interpreted two ways, and one of the ways
makes you sad or angry, we meant the other one.

27.) Let us ogle. We're going to look anyway; it's genetic.

28.) You can either tell us to do something OR tell us how to do something,
but not both.

29.) Whenever possible, please say whatever you have to say during
commercials.

30.) If it itches, it will be scratched.

31.) Beer is as exciting for us as handbags are for you.

32.) If we ask what's wrong and you say "nothing," we will act like
nothing's wrong.

33.) We know you're lying, but it's just not worth the hassle.



The information contained in or attached to this message is confidential
and is solely for the use of the addressee.  If you are not the intended
recipient please notify us immediately by return email to

and delete the message from your system. Internet communications
are not secure.The Newton group and other subsidiaries of
